snippet: BNY Mellon is at the center of a fierce competition between New York and New Jersey for a subsidy deal to either move or relocate in Lower Manhattan.
abstract: BNY Mellon is at center of fierce tug-of-war between New York and New Jersey to either move or relocate its headquarters, along with more than 1,100 employees; both Gov Chris Christie and Gov Andrew M Cuomo are offering huge subsidies in hopes of luring bank to their state's side of Hudson River.
lead_paragraph: BNY Mellon is at the center of a fierce competition between New York and New Jersey for a subsidy deal to either move or relocate in Lower Manhattan.
